abstract: Editorial on discovery by researchers at Cornell University that most land vertebrates--including humans--are descended from a predatory fish that lived hundreds of millions of years ago and could sense electrical fields in its environment; maintains that the findings, published in journal Nature, remind one how much remains to be learned about mankind's origins.
snippet: We know we are descended from somewhere, but who would have suspected it was by way of a fish that used electrical currents to hunt and communicate?
lead_paragraph: We know we are descended from somewhere, but who would have suspected it was by way of a fish that used electrical currents to hunt and communicate?
